comments.author: trevorhemail-mozbug@yahoo.com.au
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110528 Firefox/7.0a1

In the Permissions Manager when All Sites is selected in the list the Manage Passwords... button is enabled even if there are no passwords to manage.

Reproducible: Always


Actual Results:  
All Sites Manage Passwords button is enabled even if there are no passwords stored.

Expected Results:  
All Sites Manage Passwords button should be disabled if there are no passwords stored.

I have not checked in a profile with no cookies if the Manage Cookies... button has the same issue. It would probably be worth checking.
comments.creator: trevorhemail-mozbug@yahoo.com.au

comments.creator: george.carstoiu@gmail.com
comments.text:
Confirming on Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110531 Firefox/7.0a1.

Setting resolution to New. Issue like this ever since about:permissions was introduced and it's present on Mac and Windows builds also.
